## Loading the Libraries
```{r}
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)

```

```{r}
data <- read.csv('Superstore.csv')
head(data)
```



```{r}
data$Order.Date <- as.Date(data$Order.Date,"%d-%m-%y")
data$Ship.Date <- as.Date(data$Ship.Date,"%d-%m-%y")

```

```{r}
str(data)
```

```{r}
## Data Cleaning
drops <- c("Row.ID")
df <- data[,!(names(data) %in% drops)]
```

```{r}
df
```

```{r}
## Check for missing values

which(is.na(data$Country.Region))
which(is.na(data$Country.Region))
which(is.na(data$Country.Region))
which(is.na(data$Country.Region))
```


```{r}
s <- df %>% group_by(Region) %>% summarise_at(vars(Profit),funs(sum(.,na.rm=TRUE)))
s
```

```{r}
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(factoextra)
data <- read.csv('Superstore.csv')
data_profit = data[,c("Customer.Name","Profit")]
avg_profit = data_profit %>% group_by(Customer.Name) %>% summarise(median(Profit))
avg_profit = as.data.frame(avg_profit)
colnames(avg_profit) = c("Customer Name","Profit")

```
